title: Conditional Sentences
description: Master conditional structures in European Portuguese

options: Se tivesse tido dinheiro, teria comprado
questions.explanation: Type 1 (real/possible): Se + future subjunctive + present indicative.

questions.prompt: Complete: 'If I had money, I would buy' → Se ___ dinheiro, ___
What tense follows 'se' in unreal conditionals?
questions.explanation: Unreal conditionals use 'se + imperfect subjunctive' in the if-clause.

questions.prompt: Build: 'If I were you, I would go'
Write 'If it rains, I'll stay home' in Portuguese
correct_answers: Se chover, vou ficar em casa

questions.prompt: What is the future subjunctive of 'ser' (eu)?
questions.explanation: 'For' is the future subjunctive of 'ser'. Used in 'se eu for...' (if I am/will be).

content.text: For habits and general facts: Se + present + present

content.target: If/When it rains, I stay home

content.text: For likely future conditions: Se + future subjunctive + present/future

content.target: If I have time, I'll go

content.text: For hypothetical present: Se + imperfect subjunctive + conditional

content.target: If I had money, I would buy

content.text: For hypothetical past: Se + past perfect subjunctive + conditional perfect

content.target: If I had studied, I would have passed

content.text: Future subjunctive is unique to Portuguese! In Spanish, present subjunctive is used instead.
The future subjunctive often looks like the personal infinitive. Context determines which it is.
